Quick search

integrate_orbit¶

clustertools.analysis.orbit.integrate_orbit(cluster, pot=[<galpy.potential.PowerSphericalPotentialwCutoff.PowerSphericalPotentialwCutoff object>, <galpy.potential.MiyamotoNagaiPotential.MiyamotoNagaiPotential object>, <galpy.potential.TwoPowerSphericalPotential.NFWPotential object>], tfinal=12.0, nt=1000, ro=8.0, vo=220.0, plot=False)[source]¶

NAME:

integrate_orbit

PURPOSE:

Integrate a galpy orbit instance for the cluster

INPUT:

cluster - StarCluster

pot - Potential orbit is to be integrate in (Default: MWPotential2014)

tfinal - final time (in Gyr) to integrate orbit to (Default: 12 Gyr)

nt - number of timesteps

ro - galpy distance scale (Default: 8.)

vo - galpy velocity scale (Default: 220.)

plot - show plot of cluster’s orbit

OUTPUT:

timesteps, orbit instance

HISTORY:

2018 - Written - Webb (UofT)
